Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Non-specific lipid transfer peptide (LTP 1; nsLTP; Plants)
Sequence Information.Source: Vigna radiata var. radiata (Mung bean) (Phaseolus aureus)
Sequence Information.Target Organism: Fungi:Fusarium solani, Fusarium oxysporum, Pythium aphanidermatum, Sclerotium rolfsii.Gram-positive Bacterium:Staphylococcus aureus.
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Structure Description: The global fold of mung bean nsLTP1 is similar to those of the monocotyledonous nsLTP1 structures and consists of four alpha-helices stabilized by four disulfide bonds.
Sequence Information.Function: Plant non-specific lipid-transfer proteins transfer phospholipids as well as galactolipids across membranes. May play a role in wax or cutin deposition in the cell walls of expanding epidermal cells and certain secretory tissues.

Literature.Title: A non-specific lipid transfer protein with antifungal and antibacterial activities from the mung bean.
Literature.Author: Wang SY, Wu JH, Ng TB, Ye XY, Rao PF.

Literature.Title: Characterization and structural analyses of nonspecific lipid transfer protein 1 from mung bean.
Literature.Author: Lin KF, Liu YN, Hsu ST, Samuel D, Cheng CS, Bonvin AM, Lyu PC.
